etymology.description: 白(白) (bái, "white") + 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") = phonetic 白 and semantic 巾 -> "silk"
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 白(白) (bái, "white") for its phonetic value and 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") for its semantic connection to textiles, resulting in the meaning of "silk," a type of cloth that often appears white.

examples.chinese: 古代贵族珍藏帛(古代貴族珍藏帛)，作为礼品赠予友人(作為禮品贈予友人)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài guìzú zhēncáng bó, zuòwéi lǐpǐn zèngyǔ yǒurén.
examples.english: Ancient nobles treasured silk and presented it as gifts to friends.

examples.chinese: 他用精緻的帛(他用精緻的帛)，制成了华丽衣衫(製成了華麗衣衫)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng jīngzhì de bó, zhìchéngle huálì yīshān.
examples.english: He used fine silk to make a gorgeous garment.
